article_node.title: 'I'm already scared enough': Epstein survivor sidesteps direct question about Trump
article_node.summary: Jeffrey Epstein survivor Marina Lacerda, joined by other survivors, appeared on Capitol Hill to urge lawmakers to mandate the release of DOJ records on Epstein’s sex‑trafficking network. She emphasized that survivors should not be silenced and called for transparency, while sidestepping a direct question about President Donald Trump. The event, organized by Representatives Thomas Massie and Ro Khanna, seeks to pressure the Trump administration to provide the requested files.
